alert.note: Alert for East Laramie County; Goshen County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 2:50PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Scotts Bluff, northern Banner, southwestern Sioux, southeastern Goshen and eastern Laramie Counties through 315 PM MDT... At 250 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near La Grange, or 23 miles southwest of Scottsbluff, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Morrill, La Grange, Lyman, Huntley, Wildcat Hills State Recreation Area, Stegall, Wildcat Hills Campground, Hawk Springs, Hawk Springs Campground, Hubbard Hill, Hawk Springs Recreation Area, Harrisburg and Henry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
